definition: Tan Sitong (1865-1898), Qing writer and politician, one of the Six Gentlemen Martyrs 戊戌六君子 of the unsuccessful reform movement of 1898

sentences.english: In China's modern history, Tan Sitong's heroic death may be the most exciting event.
sentences.chinese: 譚嗣同的慷慨成仁是中國近代史上最激動人心的華章。

sentences.english: Early years, such as the creation of the Southern Society and Tan.
sentences.chinese: 早年與譚嗣同等創立南學會。

sentences.english: Tan Hi "to ride the unruly text, speaking slightly Overlord statecraft."
sentences.chinese: 譚嗣同喜“爲馳騁不羈之文，講霸王經世之略”。

sentences.english: Tan Sitong was an outstanding social reformer at the end of the Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 譚嗣同是清末傑出的社會改革家。
